raw_text:
Ocean's Twelve raids box office
 
 Ocean's Twelve, the crime caper sequel starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt and Julia Roberts, has gone straight to number one in the US box office chart.
 
 It took $40.8m (£21m) in weekend ticket sales, according to studio estimates. The sequel follows the master criminals as they try to pull off three major heists across Europe. It knocked last week's number one, National Treasure, into third place. Wesley Snipes' Blade: Trinity was in second, taking $16.1m (£8.4m). Rounding out the top five was animated fable The Polar Express, starring Tom Hanks, and festive comedy Christmas with the Kranks.
 
 Ocean's Twelve box office triumph marks the fourth-biggest opening for a December release in the US, after the three films in the Lord of the Rings trilogy. The sequel narrowly beat its 2001 predecessor, Ocean's Eleven which took $38.1m (£19.8m) on its opening weekend and $184m (£95.8m) in total. A remake of the 1960s film, starring Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack, Ocean's Eleven was directed by Oscar-winning director Steven Soderbergh. Soderbergh returns to direct the hit sequel which reunites Clooney, Pitt and Roberts with Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Elliott Gould. Catherine Zeta-Jones joins the all-star cast. "It's just a fun, good holiday movie," said Dan Fellman, president of distribution at Warner Bros. However, US critics were less complimentary about the $110m (£57.2m) project, with the Los Angeles Times labelling it a "dispiriting vanity project". A milder review in the New York Times dubbed the sequel "unabashedly trivial".
llama3.2:1b: Ocean's Twelve grossed $40.8m at US box office.
It became number one after knocking National Treasure down two spots.
The film has now become the fourth-biggest December release in US box office history, following Lord of the Rings trilogy films.
llama3.2:3b: Ocean's Twelve opened at number one in the US box office, taking $40.8m (£21m) in weekend ticket sales.
It knocked National Treasure into third place and beat its predecessor Ocean's Eleven.
Critics described it as a "dispiriting vanity project" and "unabashedly trivial".

The film beat its predecessor Ocean's Eleven and stars George Clooney, Brad Pitt and Julia Roberts along with Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Elliott Gould.

A remake of the 1960s film, starring Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack, was directed by Oscar-winning director Steven Soderbergh.
A milder review called it a "dispiriting vanity project".
qwen2.5:1.5b: Ocean's Twelve has topped US box office charts for its opening weekend, taking $40.8 million and defeating previous records set by Lord of the Rings trilogy films.
The movie features George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts in a heist storyline that follows their previous roles as criminals.
It beat last week's number one release with $16.1 million from its opening weekend and overtook 2001's Ocean's Eleven at total earnings.
Critics' reviews were mixed; some praised it as a fun holiday movie, while others deemed it trivial or disappointing.
qwen2.5:3b: Ocean's Twelve, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt and Julia Roberts, took $40.8m (£21m) on its opening weekend and topped US box office charts.
It followed National Treasure (3rd), Blade: Trinity (2nd) and The Polar Express & Christmas with the Kranks (5th).
As the fourth-biggest December release in the US after Lord of the Rings, it outperformed 2001's Ocean's Eleven ($38.1m/£19.8m opening weekend, $184m total).
Warner Bros' president Dan Fellman described it as "fun" while critics like The Los Angeles Times were more negative, calling it a "dispiriting vanity project".
opencoder:1.5b: Ocean's Twelve raids box office, marked the fourth-biggest opening for a December release in the US after its three major heists across Europe.
The films were narrowly beaten by their 2001 predecessor, Ocean's Eleven with $38.1m (£19.8m) and $184m (£95.8m) total earnings.
The remake of the 1970s film, starring Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack, directed by Oscar-winning director Steven Soderbergh, was released in 1997 at $110m (£57.2m).
However, US critics were less pleased with the $110m project, with the Los Angeles Times labelling it a "dispiriting vanity project".
A more positive review is attributed to Dan Fellman, president of distribution at Warner Bros.
smollm:1.7b: Ocean's Twelve is a crime caper sequel that has gone straight to number one in the US box office chart.
It was released on November 24, 2015 and grossed $40.8 million (£21.3m) in weekend ticket sales.
The film follows the same cast of characters as Ocean's Eleven, but with a different storyline.
Ocean's Twelve is also notable for its box office performance, which knocked last week's number one, National Treasure, into third place.
The sequel narrowly beat its 2001 predecessor, Ocean's Eleven, which took $38.1 million (£19.8m) on its opening weekend and $184 million (£95.8m) in total.
A remake of the 1960s film, starring Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack, was also released, but it failed to attract the same level of critical acclaim as Ocean's Eleven.
Catherine Zeta-Jones joins the all-star cast for Ocean's Twelve, which is a fun, good holiday movie.
However, US critics were less complimentary about the $110 million (£57.2m) project, with the Los Angeles Times labelling it a "dispiriting vanity project".
A milder review in the New York Times dubbed the sequel "unabashedly trivial", and many viewers felt that the film was too focused on the characters' personalities rather than the plot.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Ocean's Twelve, a crime drama starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, and Julia Roberts, has achieved record US box office sales with $40.8 million in weekend ticket sales.
Following National Treasure, it fell to third place.
The sequel, which follows master criminals across Europe, features Wesley Snipes' Blade: Trinity, Tom Hanks' The Polar Express, and Rizal Williams' Christmas with the Kranks.
While the box office success highlights its popularity among audiences, US critics are more critical of the project.
tinyllama:1.1b: In the US box office chart, Ocean's Twelve, the crime caper sequel starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, and Julia Roberts has gone straight to number one.
The film took $40.8m (£21m) in ticket sales during its opening weekend, according to studio estimates.

The sequel follows the master criminal's three major heists across Europe as they try to pull off a series of elaborate and dangerous stunts that include a kidnapping, a hostage situation, and a bank robbery.
Despite negative reviews, Ocean's Twelve is expected to earn $161m (£84.7m) domestically in its first four weeks of release.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The Ocean's Twelve box office success has surpassed previous December openers.
It took $40.8m (£21m) in weekend ticket sales, which is the fourth-biggest opening for a December release in US history.
Including its second and third place finishes, it topped the previous record, held by The Polar Express's $16.1m.
Ocean's Twelve's success also marks the fourth-biggest box office opening of a December film ever, after the three films in the Lord of the Rings trilogy and The Shawshank Redemption.
This is especially impressive considering that it is a sequel and not a remake like Ocean's Eleven or Ocean's 11.
Ocean's Twelve is directed by Steven Soderbergh, who has directed previous successful films like Chariots of Fire and Haywire.
The film features a star-studded cast, including George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, and Matt Damon.
The movie's success has been praised by critics, with the Los Angeles Times calling it "trivial" and the New York Times saying it is an "unabashedly trivial sequel."

Starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt and Julia Roberts, the movie follows a team of master criminals as they try to pull off three major heists across Europe.
Although it narrowly beat its predecessor, Ocean'S Eleven, the film has received mixed reviews from US critics.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Ocean's Twelve, a crime caper sequel featuring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia, and Elliott Gould, opened at the top of the US box office with $40.8m in ticket sales during its debut weekend.
This performance outperformed its predecessor, Ocean's Eleven (2001), which earned $38.1m in its opening weekend and $184m overall.
The film, directed by Steven Soderbergh, follows the criminals as they execute three major heists across Europe.
In second place was Wesley Snipes' Blade: Trinity, with $16.1m.
The top five also included The Polar Express and Christmas with the Kranks.

Despite positive distribution views as a "fun, good holiday movie," US critics were more mixed, with the Los Angeles Times calling it a "dispiriting vanity project" and the New York Times deeming it "unabashedly trivial."
chatgpt-4o-latest: Ocean's Twelve debuted at number one in the US box office, earning $40.8 million in its opening weekend.
The sequel follows master criminals attempting heists across Europe and surpassed its predecessor, Ocean's Eleven, which earned $38.1 million in its debut.
It marked the fourth-biggest December opening after the Lord of the Rings films.
Directed by Steven Soderbergh, the film reunites George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, and others, with Catherine Zeta-Jones joining the cast.
Despite its commercial success, critics were less favorable, with the Los Angeles Times calling it a "dispiriting vanity project" and the New York Times describing it as "unabashedly trivial."
